description: The Madhya Pradesh HC annulled the termination of a Bhopal Development Authority employee, Vijay Singh Yadav, citing the absence of proper enquiry and the application of disproportionate punishment. The court emphasized the importance of a thorough investigation and adherence to natural justice principles, ordering Yadav's reinstatement with back wages and benefits.
title: Penalty must be proportionate to charges, HC cites Ashoka

description: The Karnataka state government admitted to mistakenly listing 1,200 acres of farmers' land as Waqf Board property in Vijayapura, leading to protests. Government officials clarified that only 11 acres belong to the Waqf Board, attributing the error to a gazette notification mistake. BJP criticized the incident as a political move.
title: Marking farm lands as waqf assets an error, will withdraw notices: Karnataka

description: The JPC on Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, meeting saw AAP's Sanjay Singh object to the Delhi Waqf Board administrator's report, claiming it wasn't CM-approved. Heated exchanges led to opposition members walking out briefly. Panel chairman Jagdambika Pal sought the Lok Sabha secretary general's opinion.
title: JPC meet on waqf bill again sees opposition MPs walk out

description: A rape convict on parole in Chhattisgarh assaulted his 11-year-old daughter and 12-year-old niece, threatening them to remain silent. The children eventually reported the crime, leading to the convict's escape. Multiple police teams are actively searching for him.
title: Serial rapist out on parole rapes minor daughter, niece

description: The Enforcement Directorate has seized assets totaling Rs 500 crore across multiple states in connection with a Rs 4,000 crore bank fraud involving Corporate Power Ltd and its promoters. The investigation was launched following a CBI FIR and Union Bank of India's allegations of financial misconduct.
title: ED attaches assets worth 500 crore across 5 states in Rs 4,000 crore Corporate Power scam

description: A 23-year-old MSc student set himself on fire during protests in Almora against the cancellation of student union elections. The demonstrations, driven by unmet electoral demands, saw increased tensions and self-immolation threats across colleges, prompting widespread student unrest and government scrutiny.
title: Student sets self afire amid Uttarakhand stir

description: On Ayurveda Day, PM Narendra Modi will launch the expansion of health coverage under Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana for senior citizens aged 70 and above. This includes an additional top-up cover of Rs 5 lakh per year for those already covered and new Rs 5 lakh family cover for others, enhancing healthcare accessibility.
title: PM Modi to launch expanded Ayushman coverage for seniors above 70 today

description: A woman died and her two daughters, along with at least 20 others, were hospitalized after consuming momos from a roadside stall in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. The incident led to the arrest of two individuals operating without an FSSAI license under unhygienic conditions.
title: One dead, 22 hospitalised after eating momos at roadside stall in Hyderabad

description: India and Spain condemned attacks on UN peacekeepers in Lebanon and emphasized their safety. Leaders Narendra Modi and Pedro Sanchez also denounced the recent terror attacks on Israel and called for a ceasefire in Gaza. They urged adherence to international law in the Ukraine conflict and promoted a free, peaceful Indo-Pacific region.
title: India, Spain condemn attacks in Lebanon on UN peacekeepers

description: Harjinder Singh Dhami was elected president of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) for the fourth consecutive time, defeating Jagir Kaur of the dissident faction. Dhami received 107 out of 142 votes. Key positions were filled, including vice-presidents and general secretary roles among others.
title: SAD’s Harjinder Singh Dhami elected SGPC chief fourth time in row

description: At least 13 villagers in Dantewada, Chhattisgarh, face severe eye infections and potential blindness following unhygienic cataract surgeries conducted at a government hospital. Health minister Shyam Bihari Jaiswal has suspended key staff, and a probe is underway to address these critical lapses.
title: 13 infected after botched eye surgery

description: A 35-year-old from Gondia district, Maharashtra, responsible for hoax emails predicting fake terror attacks, has increased airport, airline, and railway security. Jagdish Uikey, on the run, claimed to have decoded a terror code and demands meetings with top officials, including PM Modi, escalating security measures.
title: Terror book author behind hoax emails to airlines

description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren’s poll proposer, Mandal Murmu, was detained by police, violating Election Commission guidelines, says state CEO K Ravi Kumar. Murmu was heading to Ranchi to discuss Bangladeshi infiltration but was detained after a vehicle search. The search procedure was not properly documented, prompting an inquiry. JMM suspects BJP foul play.
title: CEO: Police flouted norms to detain Hemant Soren proposer

description: Ajit Pawar and Yugendra Pawar filed their nominations in Baramati, reflecting contrasting campaign strategies. Ajit led a rally, supported by his sons and scheme beneficiaries, while Yugendra followed Sharad Pawar's traditional approach. Both avoided direct encounters during the filing process.
title: Baramati Pawar players enter arena, in their individual styles

description: A live grenade was discovered at the entrance of GP Women's College in Imphal, causing panic and protests among students. This incident follows a series of extortion threats to educational institutions and bomb hoaxes elsewhere. A cryptic note found with the grenade criticized the education system and demanded respect for proletarian students' free education movement.
title: Live grenade near Manipur Raj Bhavan sparks panic

description: With Maharashtra's assembly election nomination deadline approaching, both major political alliances, Mahayuti and MVA, struggle to finalize candidates for all seats, reflecting intense seat-sharing negotiations and dealing with rebel candidates. Both alliances are unsually delayed in confirming nominees, signifying complex coalition dynamics.
title: On eve of nomination deadline, Maharashtra fronts still undecided on dozen seats

description: Russian ambassador Denis Alipov lauds the India-China agreement on resolving the Ladakh standoff and emphasizes the significance of mutual trust for border resolution. He underscores the inclusive nature of the BRICS platform and refutes Ukraine's negative comments. Alipov highlights India-Russia cooperation efforts amidst financial challenges.
title: No role in setting up Modi-Xi meet in Kazan, says Russia, hails pact

description: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for October 29, 2024. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.
title: Horoscope today, October 29: Read your today's astrological predictions

description: PM Narendra Modi and Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez inaugurated TATA's first private military aircraft factory in Vadodara for C-295 aircraft production, aiming to boost 'Make in India, Make for the World'. The project is expected to generate jobs and elevate India's defence manufacturing and aviation sectors.
title: PM Modi, Spain’s Sanchez open first private military plane facility in India

description: Delhi police are investigating a firing incident at a businessman’s house in Rani Bagh, possibly involving the Bambiha syndicate. This third gang poses additional challenges to the crime-plagued city, with links to pro-Khalistan factions and a history of extortion, intimidation, and high-profile murders.
title: Bambiha syndicate is the newest entrant in Delhi’s crowded crime landscape

description: The Madras High Court's Madurai bench ruled that the Shariat Council cannot issue divorce certificates or enforce penalties, affirming that only state-constituted courts can deliver judgments. The court directed the husband to seek a legal declaration of divorce, emphasizing the ongoing subsistence of the marriage.
title: Shariat Council not a court, husband must get legal stamp on talaq: HC

description: Independent MP Pappu Yadav claimed to have received death threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang following his derogatory comments about them. Yadav, who has Y category security, requested an upgrade to Z category. The threat call was allegedly made by jailed gangster Aman Sahu. Police are investigating and reviewing Yadav's security arrangements.
title: After calling Bishnoi gang ‘petty thugs’, Pappu gets death threat

description: The Delhi high court granted bail to two Bhushan Steel Limited officials in a Rs 46,000-crore money laundering case, citing delays in trial. The court emphasized that Section 45 of the PMLA should not be used to indefinitely detain accused and highlighted the importance of the right to liberty and speedy trial under Article 21.
title: Upholding right to liberty and speedy trial, HC grants bail in PMLA case

description: India and China have nearly completed disengagement in Demchok and Depsang, with troops retreating to pre-April 2020 positions. Verification is underway using physical checks and UAVs. Future coordinated patrols are planned, while broader de-escalation along the entire LAC remains unresolved.
title: Troop disengagement nearly complete at 2 Ladakh sites

description: San Francisco 49ers' Nick Bosa faced criticism for wearing a MAGA hat during an interview post the team's win over Dallas. According to NFL rules, players are banned from displaying political messages on uniforms. While Bosa’s performance remains stellar, his political stance could potentially lead to penalties as NFL's policies on political expressions might come into play.
title: CJ Stroud’s coach calls out Nick Bosa ‘weak’

description: A terrorist was killed after attacking an Army convoy in Sunderbani sector near Jammu. The incident left no soldiers injured, though a military assault dog named Phantom died from gunshot wounds. Authorities have urged the public to avoid spreading misinformation.
title: Terrorist killed after attack on Army convoy in J&K's Akhnoor

description: Elon Musk warns of a "financial emergency" as U.S. government interest payments now surpass $1 trillion annually, exceeding the Defense Department budget. With the national debt at $35.7 trillion, analysts predict it could reach $36 trillion by year's end, prompting a shift to assets like Bitcoin and gold.
title: Elon Musk declares ‘financial emergency’: What’s behind the $35 trillion ‘time bomb’ US is said to be facing

description: Gold prices have surged by 25-30% since last Dhanteras, reaching near record highs both domestically and internationally. This increase has led to concerns among jewellers about a potential drop in sales this festive season. Demand has shifted towards lower-priced gold jewellery, with overall sales expected to decrease by around 20%.
title: Will high gold price play spoilsport on Dhanteras?

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi plans to inaugurate healthcare projects worth Rs 12,850 crore on the 9th Ayurveda Day, including extending Ayushman Bharat coverage to citizens over 70. Additionally, the U-WIN portal will be launched for digitizing vaccination for pregnant women and infants, along with the 'Desh Ka Prakriti Parikshan Abhiyan' campaign to enhance health awareness.
title: PM Modi to launch healthcare projects worth Rs 13k cr on 9th Ayurveda Day

description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce had confirmed their romance in September 2023. They frequently communicate through texts and FaceTime. Kelce often sends flowers and gifts to Swift. Their relationship is growing stronger despite their busy schedules. Fans and followers are eager to see what the future holds for the couple.
title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce capture hearts with engagement buzz

description: Dhanteras marks the beginning of the Diwali festival, focusing on wealth and prosperity. Celebrants worship Lord Dhanvantari for health and buy gold, silver, and utensils for good fortune. The article includes heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to share on social media, enhancing the festivity's spirit. Happy Dhanteras is the central greeting theme.
title: Happy Dhanteras 2024: Wishes, messages, quotes

description: Diwali, celebrated on October 31 this year, symbolises the victory of light over darkness and good over evil. The festival involves lighting diyas, bursting crackers, and exchanging sweets. Sharing heartfelt wishes and messages with loved ones enhances the joy and togetherness of the celebration.
title: Happy Diwali 2024: Best messages, quotes, wishes to share

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commended Rani Rampal, former captain of India's women's hockey team, for her outstanding career and contributions. He praised her for being a role model for Nari Shakti, acknowledging her achievements and expressing optimism as she transitions to a mentorship role after retirement.
title: PM Modi writes to ex-women's hockey team captain Rani Rampal

description: Labour Party MP Mike Amesbury has been suspended after CCTV footage showed him punching a man. Amesbury claimed he felt threatened during the incident. He reported the altercation to Cheshire Police and will cooperate with their investigation. Amesbury has represented Cheshire since 2017 and was previously a shadow minister.
title: In video: UK MP's viral footage of punching man gets him suspended
Biden to celebrate Diwali amid Indian-American drift away from Dems

description: Former PCB chairman Ramiz Raja defends his post-match remarks to Shan Masood after Pakistan's 2-1 Test series win over England. Raja clarifies his intention was to explore how the team overcame recent struggles, not to belittle their achievement. Responding to criticism, he highlights the impact of social media misinterpretations and asserts his respect for Masood's captaincy.
title: 'Pakistan zinda hi social media pe hai': Ramiz Raja

description: The former official residence of Bangladesh's ex-leader Sheikh Hasina will be turned into a museum to memorialize her removal following a student-led uprising. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus announced that the museum will feature exhibits on human rights abuses and repression during her 15-year regime, highlighting public anger and unrest.
title: Hasina’s palace to be converted into Revolution museum
Sharad Pawar vs Ajit Pawar Round 2: Maha deputy CM faces 'nephew challenge' in Baramati

description: Donald Trump held a massive and controversial rally at Madison Square Garden, drawing comparisons to a 1939 pro-Nazi event. Critics labeled it a 'hate rally,' while MAGA supporters defended it, highlighting diverse speakers and Musk's memes. Discussions intensified around Trump's potential second-term actions.
title: Neo-Nazi or no-Nazi? MAGA and liberals duke it out over MSG rally

description: Manchester United parted ways with Erik ten Hag following a poor season start, placing them 14th in the Premier League. Ten Hag's successes were overshadowed by inconsistent performances and tactical struggles. Ruud van Nistelrooy steps in as interim manager, with names like Rúben Amorim, Simone Inzaghi, Gareth Southgate, and Xavi considered for the permanent role.
title: 5 favourites to replace Erik ten Hag at Manchester United

description: Apple invites security researchers to test its Private Cloud Compute system, offering up to $1 million for uncovering vulnerabilities.
title: Apple has a Rs 8 crore ‘Apple Intelligence challenge’ for developers

description: Manchester United have dismissed Erik ten Hag after a defeat at West Ham left the club in 14th place in the Premier League. Appointed in 2022, ten Hag’s early success faded amid inconsistent performances and last season’s disappointing 8th-place finish. The club now seeks a new manager to revive its fortunes.
title: How managers have fared since Alex Ferguson left Man United

description: Negotiations for a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) between India and the European Union remain a priority, with both sides pushing for an "early and ambitious" deal, said the Ministry of External Affairs on Monday, hours after bilateral talks between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Spanish counterpart Pedro Sanchez here.
title: EU & India push for 'early' free trade agreement
Govt warns against illegal digital payment gateways used by cybercriminals
'His courage and loyalty': Army dog Phantom dies in J&K operations

description: Elon Musk, the world's wealthiest man, has significantly influenced the 2024 US presidential elections by investing $132 million to support Donald Trump's re-election campaign. Musk's financial backing through America PAC focuses on voter mobilization in key swing states, raising ethical and legal questions about his involvement and potential conflicts of interest, especially given Musk’s business ties with the government.
title: Can Elon Musk, the world's richest man, 'buy' US elections for Trump?

description: Swiggy Ltd., an Indian food-delivery platform, plans to raise $1.35 billion through an IPO at 390 rupees per share. Opening on November 6, this move follows a surge in India's IPO market, highlighted by Hyundai Motor India's recent $3.3 billion IPO. Swiggy partners with over 200,000 restaurants across India.
title: Swiggy seeking to sell shares for up to Rs 390 each in IPO

description: At a Trump rally, comedian Tony Hinchcliffe's offensive joke about Puerto Rico sparked outrage, leading prominent Latinos to defend the island. Remarks against Kamala Harris and minorities drew widespread condemnation, even from some Republicans, creating a backlash just days before the election.
title: Puerto Rico-chet: Anti-Latino joke at Trump rally misfires on MAGA

description: The National Testing Agency has initiated online registration for the JEE Main January 2025 Session 1 on jeemain.nta.nic.in. Registration is open from October 28 till November 22, 2024, 9PM. Key dates include exams between January 22-31, 2025, and results expected by February 12, 2025. The announcement of exam cities by early January.
title: NTA begins online registration for JEE Mains 2025: Check schedule, exam pattern

description: President Joe Biden will celebrate Diwali at the White House, lighting a traditional Diya lamp and speaking at a reception for the Indian American community. This year marks Biden's final such event as he won't seek re-election. A video message from astronaut Sunita Williams will also be featured.
title: Biden's final Diwali at White House to feature special message from space

description: Prithvi Shaw was excluded from Mumbai's Ranji Trophy squad due to fitness and disciplinary issues. Sunil Gavaskar defended him, emphasizing that a player's weight should not determine their fitness. He highlighted Sarfaraz Khan's performance as an example, arguing that the ability to score runs or bowl consistently should be the primary criteria.
title: Gavaskar backs Prithvi Shaw amid fitness concerns

description: Harvard professors Steven Levitsky and Daniel Ziblatt suggest a 'militant democracy' approach to protect American democracy from threats, particularly under a potential second term of Donald Trump. They argue traditional safeguards have failed, citing measures like disqualifying anti-democratic candidates and mobilizing civil society to resist authoritarianism, calling for urgent action to safeguard the republic.
title: Does US need a 'militant democracy' to stop Donald Trump?

description: Myles Garrett, a player for the Cleveland Browns, donned an impressive Terminator costume for Halloween. The costume was so detailed that it caught the attention and praise of the original Terminator, Arnold Schwarzenegger. Garrett has a history of elaborate Halloween costumes, and this year’s transformation continues his trend of thrilling displays.
title: Arnold reacts to Myles Garrett’s arriving in ‘Terminator’ costume

description: Manchester United has parted ways with manager Erik ten Hag with the team languishing 14th in the Premier League standings after nine games. Ruud van Nistelrooy will step in as interim head coach. Despite an FA Cup win and a contract extension, early results this season have not met expectations, prompting the change.
title: Manchester United sack manager Erik ten Hag

description: Sheikh Abdul Rashid criticizes Farooq and Omar Abdullah for their inconsistent stances on Pakistan and Article 370, accusing them of double standards. Rashid expresses conditional support for Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah, contingent on actions benefiting Kashmiris. Rashid also rebukes Abdullah for not fulfilling promises regarding the region's capital.
title: Engineer Rashid surrenders to Tihar, accuses Abdullahs of 'double standard' politics

description: Olympus has dismissed its global CEO, Stefan Kaufmann, following allegations of illegal drug purchases. His predecessor, Yasuo Takeuchi, returns as interim CEO.
title: Japanese camera giant fires CEO facing illegal drug allegations

description: Nick Bosa of the San Francisco 49ers may face NFL punishment for making a political statement by wearing a 'Make America Great Again' hat during a post-game interview. This act appears to violate NFL rules against political messages. Bosa's past conservative actions and comments create further controversy.
title: 49ers Nick Bosa might face punishment from the NFL for flashing MAGA cap

description: Dhanteras marks the beginning of Diwali with traditions of buying gold, silver, and other auspicious items. Celebrated on Oct 29, 2024, it involves worshipping deities for health and wealth, lighting diyas, and cleaning homes to invite prosperity for the upcoming year.
title: Dhanteras: Celebrate health & wealth with auspicious Puja and shopping Muhurat

description: Nato's Mark Rutte confirmed North Korea has sent troops to Russia to assist in its ongoing conflict with Ukraine. North Korean units are being deployed in Russia's Kursk region, a move seen as escalating the war and threatening global security. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy indicated that approximately 10,000 North Korean soldiers may soon be involved.
title: North Korea has sent troops to help Russia in Ukraine war: Nato

description: Pakistan cricketer Ahmed Shehzad criticized the PCB's management after Gary Kirsten suddenly resigned as the white-ball head coach. Kirsten, who was appointed in April, left after just six months, hinting at internal issues. Jason Gillespie will now lead the team for the Australia tour. Reports suggest tensions over voting powers influenced Kirsten’s departure.
title: 'Another day, another humiliation': PCB gets flak for Kirsten resignation

description: Comedian Kunal Kamra has highlighted issues with Ola Electric's service, tagging ministers for intervention. He responded to a video showing neglected Ola scooters in Solapur and called out the company's accountability. Kamra has humorously agreed to accept Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal’s job offer, provided the company meets specific commitments he outlined.
title: Kunal Kamra vs Ola back to where it started

description: Manchester United have parted ways with Erik ten Hag after a poor start to the season, leaving them 14th in the Premier League table. Sunday's loss to West Ham was the final straw. Ruud van Nistelrooy will be interim manager as the club searches for a permanent replacement. Ten Hag's tenure faced criticism, especially after recent performances.
title: 'Erik ten Hag was over-promoted, delusional, disrespectful'

description: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma accuses Jharkhand's government of allowing infiltrators, claims growing Muslim population is overshadowing local tribals. He pledges the BJP will implement NRC in Santhal Pargana if elected, amid increased efforts to curb border infiltration. Jharkhand elections are pivotal due to rising concerns.
title: Assam CM says 'infiltrators' behind Muslim population spike in J'khand

description: Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar, in an emotional outburst, accused uncle Sharad Pawar of dividing the family. Ajit Pawar filed the nomination on Monday for Maharashtra assembly elections from Baramati assembly and is fielded against nephew Yugendra Pawar.
title: 'Saheb created split': Ajit hits out at Sharad Pawar for 'low-level' politics

description: India's first private military aircraft manufacturing facility, inaugurated by PM Modi in Vadodara, marks a shift towards self-reliance in defense. The facility will assemble Airbus C-295 aircraft to enhance the Indian Air Force's capabilities. The project is expected to generate significant employment and strengthen India's aerospace supply chain, aligning with the 'Make in India' initiative.
title: 'Make in India, Make for world': Why C-295 aircraft factory is a game-changer

description: Forty days after NEET PG 2024 counselling registration began, the official schedule is still pending on the MCC website, causing frustration among medical aspirants. Discrepancies in exam results have led to legal petitions and interventions by medical associations, with calls for swift resolution to delays.
title: NEET PG counselling delay: Students, seniors demand quick release of schedule

description: Dia Gosai, a specially-abled girl from Vadodara, presented portraits of PM Narendra Modi and Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez during their roadshow. The leaders were in town for the inauguration of Tata Advanced Systems Limited and Airbus facility to manufacture C-295 aircraft. Cultural performances highlighted the roadshow, celebrating the launch of India's first private military aircraft assembly line.
title: Watch: Specially-abled Vadodara girl presents portraits to PM Modi, Spain PM

description: Indian pacer Mohsin Khan revealed his deep admiration for MS Dhoni, calling him his lifelong idol. Khan recalled feeling immense joy when Dhoni hit the winning six in the 2011 World Cup final. Although nervous to approach Dhoni, Khan cherishes watching him play. Meanwhile, Dhoni has hinted at extending his cricket career, fueling speculation about his future in IPL.
title: Indian bowler reveals why he can't talk to Dhoni, says...

description: For years, engineering was the dominant field in India, with 1.5 million graduates annually. However, only 10% are expected to secure jobs in 2024 due to a significant skills gap. Despite 60% seeking employment, only 45% meet industry standards, highlighting a critical disconnect between academic training and market needs.
title: Only 10% of 15 lakh engineering graduates likely to land jobs this year

description: Kenneth Clarke’s 1996 whisky-sipping speech was, to date, the last instance of a Chancellor indulging in anything stronger than water. Clarke’s whisky budget was bold and confident, a farewell to the days when budgets were laced with a bit of liquid courage. As whisky gave way to water, some claimed the country’s economic fate lost its edge.
title: How UK economy has suffered since Chancellors swapped alcohol for water

description: Indian pacer Mohsin Khan praised Rohit Sharma’s batting skills, noting his ability to play fast bowling with ease. Steve Smith also named Rohit in his World Test XI for his aggressive intent with the new ball. Rohit faces challenges after India’s Test series defeat, but he will soon lead the team in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.
title: Difference between Rohit and other batters? IPL star explains

description: A Bengaluru techie lost Rs 4.5 lakh in a gift card scam after receiving a fraudulent WhatsApp message, seemingly from his boss. He bought and shared Apple voucher codes, later discovering the scam through HR. An FIR was filed, and police have begun investigating. Victims face challenges as Apple support operates only during weekdays.
title: How 'Diwali gift' scam message on WhatsApp cost Bengaluru techie Rs 4.5 Lakh

description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized the BJP-led central government, alleging policies favoring Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s close associates. Addressing a gathering in Wayanad, she urged the protection of citizens' rights and received strong local support. The Wayanad bypoll, scheduled for November 13, is crucial for Congress.
title: ‘Policy after policy made for PM’s friends’: Priyanka Gandhi's all-out attack

description: The Centre is set to start the delayed census by early 2025, with data release in 2026. No caste census decision yet. Census delays due to Covid-19, with public data last collected in 2011. Congress calls for all-party meet to discuss caste enumeration and delimitation concerns.
title: Census likely to be held in 2025, no decision on caste data yet: Report

description: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh suggests Mumbai Indians will retain Hardik Pandya, Jasprit Bumrah, and Suryakumar Yadav ahead of the 2025 IPL mega auction. While uncertain about retaining Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan emphasizes his World Cup win as a captain should secure his spot. He also suggests Tilak Varma and Nehal Wadhera as promising future talents for the team.
title: Harbhajan predicts MI's key retentions

description: A Delhi-based app developer tried to trade a domain for his higher education funding from Reliance Industries. After being refused, the domain was sold to young Dubai-based siblings, raising questions about cybersquatting and domain ownership laws in India.
title: JioHotstar.com ownership dispute explained: How domain went to Dubai siblings

description: India's Test cricket standout home performance was halted by New Zealand, highlighting dips in form for key batsmen Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Despite contributions from the lower middle order rescuing previous matches, failure in recent series resulted in India's first home defeat since 2012.
title: What cost India first Test series defeat in more than two years

description: BJP's Amit Malviya questions the acceptance of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's nomination affidavit for Wayanad bypolls, alleging incomplete asset disclosure. Earlier BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia claimed that she violated Supreme Court directives by omitting key information about her and her husband Robert Vadra's assets. Priyanka's declared assets total over Rs 12 crore, with significant liabilities noted.
title: 'Who is holding elections?': BJP questions acceptance of Priyanka's affidavit

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday announced the inauguration of a Tata Aircraft Complex to manufacture C-295 aircraft, aimed at bolstering India-Spain relations and advancing the 'Make in India, Make for the World' mission. The factory is expected to aid India's defense manufacturing ecosystem and facilitate exports of locally assembled aircraft.
title: Tata-Airbus C-295: Top features of India’s first privately built aircraft

description: An explosion at the Ordnance Factory Khamaria in Bhopal killed two employees and injured 11 others. A social media post from an account named 'Pakistan Zindabad' showcasing a video of the factory has raised alarm, prompting an investigation into its origin and intent by intelligence agencies.
title: Jabalpur factory blast: Intel agencies probe viral 'Pakistan Zindabad' video

description: Shreya Life Sciences, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, is playing a significant role in exporting advanced technology to Russia, bypassing US and EU sanctions. Trade data reveals the legal shipment of high-end Dell servers worth $300 million, equipped with NVIDIA's restricted H100 chips, through intermediaries. This has intensified concerns among Western allies about India's growing intermediary role.
title: How a Mumbai drugmaker is helping Putin get Nvidia AI chips

description: MP Pappu Yadav received a death threat allegedly from the Lawrence Gang, warning him to stay away from the Salman Khan case. The threat, made from a UAE number, prompted Yadav to demand increased security and special arrangements from the Union Home Minister and Bihar DGP.
title: Pappu Yadav demands 'Z' category security after threats from Bishnoi gang

description: Prime Ministers Narendra Modi and Pedro Sanchez inaugurated the TASL-Airbus facility in India to manufacture C-295 military aircraft. This facility is the first private sector final assembly line in the country and supports the 'Make in India, Make for the World' mission. The $2.8 billion project will generate thousands of jobs and aims to transform India into an aviation hub.
title: 'Ratan Tata would have been happy': PM Modi, Spain PM launch C295 factory

description: The 2023/24 Ballon d'Or awards in Paris see Real Madrid's Vinicius Junior and Barcelona's Aitana Bonmati as frontrunners. Vinicius had a standout season with Real Madrid, winning La Liga and the Champions League. Bonmati led Barcelona to a historic quadruple. Winners will be decided by an international jury of football journalists.
title: Ballon d'Or 2024: Who are favourites for the Ballon d'Or?

description: Donald Trump claimed that Google CEO Sundar Pichai personally praised his McDonald's visit in Pennsylvania, labeling it a significant event for Google. Trump also stated he briefly worked as a fry cook there. Additionally, Trump alleged similar calls from Apple CEO Tim Cook and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, though these claims remain unverified.
title: Trump: Sundar Pichai called me to say, 'this was the biggest thing on Google'

description: The BCCI's exclusion of Ruturaj Gaikwad from the squads for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and T20I series against South Africa has sparked outrage. Despite Gaikwad's strong form and two first-class centuries, the selectors chose Abhimanyu Easwaran. Former cricketer Krisnamachari Srikkanth criticized the decision, questioning the selection committee's inconsistent approach.
title: 'What are you doing with Ruturaj Gaikwad?': Cricket legend to selectors
Watch: Trump dances to 'YMCA'; Melania cheers him on with applause

description: The Iskcon temple in Tirupati received a bomb threat via email on Sunday, warning of potential attacks by Pakistan's ISI-related terrorists. Heightened security measures were promptly implemented, and thorough searches by the Bomb Disposal Squad revealed no explosives. This incident follows a series of recent hoax bomb threats in Tirupati.
title: Tirupati's Iskcon temple gets bomb threat

description: During his Mann ki Baat address, PM Narendra Modi cautioned against rising digital arrest scams, revealing Indians lost Rs 120.3 crore in Q1 2024 alone. He shared a three-step strategy to combat these frauds: 'stop, think, act', and urged victims to report incidents via helpline 1930 and cybercrime.gov.in.
title: Digital arrest scam: Indians lost Rs 120 crore in first 3 months of 2024

description: The Russia-Ukraine war has devastated the eastern regions of Donetsk and Donbas, with the industrial town of Vovchansk nearly destroyed. Civilians face harsh conditions, and familial bonds are fracturing along political lines. Despite severe sanctions, Russia's economy endures, largely due to oil trade with India and China.
title: How Russia transformed Ukrainian city Vovchansk into a ghost town

description: India's cricket fans express concern over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's poor form in Tests against New Zealand, questioning their absence from domestic cricket. Former selector Sunil Joshi emphasizes the need for top players to participate in domestic matches to improve their performance against spin.
title: If Sachin can play Ranji at 40, why can't Virat & Rohit? Fans ask

description: The ICC World Test Championship standings are highly competitive, with India and Australia leading. Both teams face crucial upcoming series that will determine their chances of making it to the 2023 title clash. Sri Lanka, South Africa, and New Zealand also remain in contention. England, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and the West Indies are currently out of contention for the final, but they will be looking to finish the cycle on a positive note with strong performances in their remaining matches.
title: Race to WTC Final: What India need to secure a spot

description: Elon Musk marked the second anniversary of his $44 billion purchase of Twitter by sharing a throwback video of his entry into the headquarters, captioned 'Let that sink in!' This milestone highlights the turbulent acquisition journey, including significant executive changes and Musk's controversial reforms aimed at enhancing platform features and promoting free speech.
title: 'Let that sink in!': Musk shares throwback video of him walking into Twitter HQ

description: India's 12-year unbeaten home run in Test cricket ended after New Zealand won the first two matches of a three-match series, breaking India's 18 series winning streak. The last time India faced a series whitewash at home was in 2000 against South Africa. New Zealand now aim for a clean sweep.
title: Will NZ sweep Test series? Relive India's last series whitewash at home

description: Vasu Baras marks the start of Diwali and will be celebrated on October 28, 2024. It is observed mainly in Maharashtra and Gujarat, but also in North India as Govatsa Dwadashi. The day is dedicated to worshipping cows, considered nurturing and dear to Lord Krishna, by offering food and performing various rituals.
title: Vasu Baras 2024: Date, Time, Puja Rituals and Significance of Rangoli

description: India's recent Test failures in Bengaluru and Pune highlight the lack of participation by key players in domestic multi-day cricket. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's absence in first-class games has raised concerns over their readiness and contributed to poor performances in these matches. To their credit, Rohit or coach Gautam Gambhir have not given the impression that they have not accepted the team's shortcomings.
title: Some hard lessons to learn for Team India after a sobering loss

description: Virat Kohli's ongoing struggle in Test cricket continues, as he has managed just 88 runs in four innings against New Zealand. Former teammate Dinesh Karthik suggests Kohli to return to domestic cricket to fix the issues in his batting, especially while facing the spinners. India's disappointing batting performance has led to two straight Test defeats against the Kiwis.
title: Advice to Virat Kohli: 'Go back to domestic cricket'

description: Renowned folk singer Sharda Sinha, 72, has been admitted to the ICU at AIIMS, Delhi, following complications from multiple myeloma, a bone marrow cancer she's battled since 2017. The Padma Bhushan awardee’s health declined further after the recent passing of her husband, Brij Kishore Sinha. Known for her Bhojpuri and Maithili songs, Sinha's music celebrates Bihar's cultural heritage, making her a beloved figure in Indian folk music.
title: Bihar’s folk icon Sharda Sinha admitted to AIIMS for critical health issues

description: MS Dhoni shares a humorous incident during an ODI match where his wife Sakshi mistakenly believes a batsman cannot be stumped off a wide ball. The anecdote highlights Dhoni's expertise in wicket-keeping and the amusing dynamic between the couple while watching cricket.
title: 'Tumko kuch nahi pata hai': When Sakshi 'taught' Dhoni about stumping

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, at the Brics Summit, highlighted India’s rich cultural heritage by gifting traditional artworks such as Jharkhand's Sohrai painting to Russian President Vladimir Putin, Maharashtra's Mother of Pearl vase to Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian, and traditional Warli painting to Uzbekistan’s President Shavkat Mirziyoyev.
title: Brics Summit: PM Modi gifts exquisite painting from Jharkhand to Putin
Terrorists open fire at an Army vehicle in J&K's Akhnoor; search operation launched

description: Fakhar Zaman has been excluded from the Pakistan Cricket Board's central contracts after eight years, primarily due to failing a fitness test and criticism of selection decisions. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi emphasized fitness concerns over Zaman's controversial social media comments. Notable inclusions in the contracts include Shaheen Shah Afridi in Category B and Haris Rauf in Category C.
title: Fakhar Zaman dropped over social media comments: PCB chairman

description: McDonald’s has reintroduced Quarter Pounders to its menu after tests confirmed no E. coli in their beef patties, linked to an outbreak that sickened 75 and killed one. Raw slivered onions, suspected as the contamination source, have been removed from the burgers and supplier Taylor Farms has issued an onion recall.
title: No E. Coli found in samples of beef patties, McDonald's quarter pounders return

description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has announced the white-ball squads for Australia tour, reinstating Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Naseem Shah. Mohammad Rizwan is the new white-ball captain, with notable absences of Fakhar Zaman and Shadab Khan. Basit Ali criticized PCB's selection processes and challenged Babar to come out in support of Zaman.
title: 'Pakistan ne India ki copy ki' - says Basit Ali on team selection

description: On October 23, the leader of the Bangladeshi interim government led by Muhammad Yunus banned BCL terming it a "terrorist organisation". According to Bangladesh's home ministry, the BCL had a history of serious misconduct over the past 15 years, including violence, harassment and exploitation of public resources, Al Jazeera reported.
title: Once ruling campuses, over 50k student affiliates of Hasina's party now in hiding

description: The Centre prepares for four significant appointments including the successor of CAG G S Murmu and reviews of RBI governor Shaktikanta Das, chief economic adviser V Anantha Nageswaran, and Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch, amidst scrutiny and potential controversies surrounding their reappointments.
title: Govt will have to decide on 4 key appointments soon

description: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, asserts that India has the essential resources—tech talent, a thriving digital economy, and extensive data—to become an AI leader. Emphasizing the need to transition from an IT outsourcing hub to an AI innovation center, he highlights India's critical role in Nvidia's operations and its potential to spearhead global AI advancements.
title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: AI can help elevate India from ...

description: Sanjay Manjrekar expressed his disappointment over India's batting against New Zealand in the second Test at Pune, highlighting Virat Kohli's misjudgment and Rohit Sharma's lack of confidence against spin. He suggested better defensive techniques, while observing Shubman Gill's struggles against spinners. India and New Zealand will now head to Mumbai for the third and final Test, beginning November 1, at the Wankhede Stadium.
title: 'Rohit was not confident, Virat Kohli misread ... '

description: Talking to TOI in an exclusive interview, Ukarine's leader , whose forces are battling a renewed Russian offensive, said India must take a position ‘beyond saying it's against war’, and that he's all for Modi hosting the second peace summit, provided Ukarine's terms are on the table.
title: ‘Modi can influence the end of war’: Zelenskyy

description: Google is set to introduce its groundbreaking AI, Project Jarvis, as early as December. This advanced AI, powered by Gemini, promises to automate tasks like research, making purchases, and booking travel, aiming to enhance user efficiency on the web.
title: Google is "working" on a secret project that can take over your PC/laptop

description: Facing a significant industry slowdown, car manufacturers like Maruti Suzuki, Honda, Mahindra, and luxury brands such as Audi and BMW are offering deep discounts, sometimes up to Rs 12 lakh, across various models from entry-level to high-end luxury. Analysts predict even deeper discounts post-Diwali to clear excess inventories.
title: Festive cheer: Auto makers announce Diwali discounts to drive sales

description: Tata Group enters the Quick Commerce market with the new service Neu Flash on its ecommerce platform Neu. Focusing on groceries, electronics, and fashion, Neu Flash leverages BigBasket, Croma, and Tata Cliq. This strategic move follows market trends, aiming to compete with established players like Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart.
title: Tata Group may launch 'Neu Flash': What is the venture

description: A 44-year-old techie from Hyderabad narrowly escapes cyber criminals after a 30-hour digital ordeal. Scammers posing as FedEx agents and Mumbai police tricked him into isolation late Friday night. The victim contacted cyber crime cops once the call dropped early Sunday morning.
title: Hyderbad techie gets trapped in 30-hour digital arrest

description: Foreign fund trading activities and quarterly earnings from major companies are expected to drive the market. Investors will assess crude oil prices due to West Asian geopolitical tensions and the rupee's performance. Waaree Energies' listing also plays a crucial role, amid US election uncertainty and significant OCT market losses.
title: FPI trades, Q2 results to shape market trend

description: Union home minister Amit Shah urges Bengal voters to support BJP to stop state-sponsored infiltration, citing issues like cattle and coal smuggling, corruption, and unsafe conditions for women. Shah also highlights the lack of Central scheme benefits in Bengal under the current government.
title: State-sponsored infiltration in West Bengal, says Shah, TMC hits back

description: Talking to TOI in an exclusive interview, Ukarine's leader , whose forces are battling a renewed Russian offensive, said India must take a position ‘beyond saying it's against war’, and that he's all for Modi hosting the second peace summit, provided Ukarine's terms are on the table.
title: ‘Modi can influence the end of war’: Zelensky

description: Air quality in Noida, Greater Noida, and Ghaziabad dipped to 'very poor' levels, with the AQI surpassing 300 in all three cities. A senior pollution board official attributed the decline to stubble burning in Pakistan. Meteorological conditions worsened the situation, leading to severe air quality predictions around Diwali.
title: AQI dips to ‘very poor’ in Noida & Ghaziabad, official blames Pak for farm fires

description: Twenty soldiers from the Indian Army's Eastern Command have earned postgraduate diplomas in Primary Chinese Language at Rashtriya Raksha University, a critical step toward enhancing communication along the LAC with China. The program, featuring a native speaker from Taiwan, prepares soldiers for effective diplomatic engagement.
title: Army jawans deployed at LAC master Chinese language at Gujarat varsity
